newsitem.title: MALAYSIA: Malaysia high-tech zone to be launched with 29 firms.
newsitem.headline: Malaysia high-tech zone to be launched with 29 firms.

text.p: Malaysia will launch its Multimedia Super Corridor (MSC) in May with a group of 29 foreign and local companies, Malaysian Prime Minister Mahathir Mohamad said on Thursday.
"In May, we are going to have a ground-breaking ceremony. At that time there will be 29 balloons marking the area where actual buildings will be built," Mahathir told a news conference.
The MSC is a nine-by-30 mile (15-by-50 km) zone extending south from Kuala Lumpur to a new international airport and the new administrative capital of Putrajaya.

By the year 2000, Malaysia hopes the corridor will provide such advanced services as smart schools, which incorporate the Internet and other computer applications into their operations, and telemedicine, which uses high-tech communications to allow doctors to help each other from remote locations, for example.
Mahathir said that Malaysia has received over 900 inquiries about the project.
On Thursday, Mahathir was briefed on progress on the MSC and other information technology projects in Malaysia at a meeting of the National Information Technology Council.
Included in the 29 firms are U.S. companies Sun Microsystems Inc and NCR Corp, Germany's Siemens AG and British Telecommunications plc.
The nine local participants include Sapura Telecommunications Bhd, private television station TV3 and Telekom Malaysia Bhd.
Mahathir said he did not know the "actual amount" of investment being made by the firms. He said the first priority for the corridor would be the building of a technology university.
